pageTitle: Patent US20030022423 - Electro ceramic components - Google Patents
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {26888=[0003] XROS, Inc., in WIPO Publication WO 00013210 published Mar. 9, 2000, has disclosed elements of a hybrid structure for a MEMS array in which an SOI mirror or micromachined structure without electrodes is bonded to an unspecified insulating substrate on which is provided electrostatic electrodes for actuation of the mirror structure. The disclosure is silent about scaling of devices or about other provisions affecting operation in a thermally-stressed environment.}
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations [0041] Other embodiments will be evident to those of ordinary skill in the art. Therefore, it is not intended that this invention be limited, except as indicated by the appended claims. [0040] The invention has been explained with reference to specific embodiments. [0039] Silicon to Thin film on any substrate material. [0038] Silicon to Thick film on any substrate material; [0037] Silicon wafer to Silicon substrate; [0036] Silicon to Flex circuit board materials; [0035] Silicon to Polyimide materials; [0034] Silicon to Fiber/Ceramic matrix board materials; [0033] Silicon to Ceramic board materials; [0032] Fabrication can take advantage of post-fire metallization and dielectric placement on ceramic, thus overcoming shrinkage issues associated with firing. The structures are also robust as compared to other structures. A variety of attachment combinations can now be employed: [0031] Direct chip attachment of the drive circuitry to the back of the substrate permits high density circuit fabrication. The substrate itself facilitates interconnection. This structure has resistors buried in the multilayer ceramic and thus the resistors are not inconveniently large and discrete. [0030] The invention has a number of structural advantages that permit scaling. [0029] Mounting the wafer or MEMS structure directly onto the mechanically robust LTCC
